greeting: I have worked as a Developer for more than 10 years now, most of them being focused on Frontend Development. For me being a Frontend Developer means to constantly adapt, learn and change methodologies, processes and tooling. This should be based on a very good understanding of the basic Frontend languages HTML, CSS and Javascript. To ensure the delivery of good code, I do my best to keep up-to-date with the latest specifications, best practices, task runners, test systems, bundlers, package managers, preprocesssors and frameworks.

data.title: Basics
data.data: HTML, CSS (SASS, SCSS, JSS, CSS Modules), JavaScript (ES6+)

data.title: Methodologies
data.data: BEM, TDD, Scrum, Kanban, Responsive Design, Accessibility, Progressive Enhancement, Performance Optimisation, SEO Optimisation

data.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
data.description: With DaWanda I worked on a multi section platform mainly consisting of a Javascript (React), HTML, ERB, SASS frontend connected to a Ruby written backend. Besides integrating new components, the focus here was on converting a very fragmented legacy codebase into a maintainable, structured system.

achievements.title: Strengths and achievements:
data: Organisation of a small team, including planning and structuring of projects and tickets
Being part of the team that relaunched the DaWanda Homepage in a modular way integrating a new structure for coding and styling
Frontend integration of the Emarsys marketing engine via a self concipated and programmed React application using CSS Modules for styling and Storybook for TDD

Relaunch of the Sales Special integration, a multi parts mechanism that enabled the setup and display of a discount special throughout the complex DaWanda website, resulting in a 90% faster setup process

data.title: Frontend Developer
data.description: During the six years I worked for ZEIT ONLINE, I participated in a lot of different information driven projects usually being handled by mixed frontend/ backend teams and managed within a Kanban or Scrum system. The technology stack I worked with, consisted most of the time of HTML, SASS, Bootstrap, Javascript, jQuery and Jinja for fronted development and XSLT, Phython and a bit of PHP for backend development. For building and testing I mostly worked with Grunt, Bower, Yeoman, Pytest, RequireJS and Selenium.

achievements.title: Strengths and achievements:
data: Being part of the team that relaunched ZEIT ONLINE in 2015, which made it one of the first major german news sites (~10 million users a month) that went fully responsive
Actively participating in the development of the award winning ZEIT Campus (www.zeit-campus.de) and ZEIT Magazin websites (www.zeit-magazin.de), both fully responsive news platforms
General website maintenance including taking care of scripts, styles, video/ image integrations, tracking or advertisement
Planing and developing micro projects like standalone webapps using HTML5 mobile techniques such as data storage and handling of touch events

data.title: Freelance Webdeveloper
data.description: During one year of freelancing I handled different projects for different clients and started to concentrate on fronted development.

achievements.title: Strengths and achievements:
data: Planing of new projects for different clients
Programming and Designing of new websites with different frontend and backend techniques (eg. PHP and jQuery)

data.title: Developer/ Project Manager
data.description: With eBay classifieds I started as the first developer being located in Germany. When a complete new platform was launched for the german market I helped implementing new customer support mechanisms and toolsets as temporary Head of Customer Support. For six months I also joined the italian eBay classifieds team, which is located in Milan as a PHP backend developer.

achievements.title: Strengths and achievements:
data: Planning and developing of new site elements and functionalities based on PHP, MySQL, HTML, XML, CSS
Managing a small team of developers
Being temporary Head of Customer Support during a transformational phase
Working within an international and very quickly developing and changing company setting

other.title: Internships and other relevant work experience

data.title: Part-time work
data: 12/2004 to 04/2006 Hascon: PHP Webdevelopment

data.title: Internships
data: 04/2005 to 09/2005 104.6 RTL: CFML Webdevelopment, Community Design
01/2003 to 06/2003 PN Internet Solutions: Web Development

data.title: Degree in Business Informatics (UAS)
data.institute: Technical University of Applied Sciences Wildau

softSkills.title: Soft Skills
data: Native speaker of german, business fluency in english
Well able to cope with new requirements as already worked with a number of different teams in different settings
Good ability to work in teams as well as self organized
Like to work accurately but also with a good portion of hands on mentality
Keen to learn new skills, for example as a frequent visitor of frontend conferences
Happy to share knowledge and also looking forward to learn from others

interests.title: Interests
interests.data: I am a passionate traveller and also like to blog about it. In the past I did this as a Backpacker, nowadays in a more organised way to show the world to my little son. I lived and worked in different countries like New Zealand and Italy within international teams, which made me a fluent speaker of English. I like outdoor activities like jogging, hiking or cycling and am interested in history, photography and contributing to Wikipedia. In 2016 I finished my part time studies of journalism at the FJS Berlin.

footer.data: Anika Szuppa - 2019 - Find the code for this CV on Github!
